* Dinobot had looked away as Tavatron had touched his arm, how could one 
such as her show compassion for one such as him? He was sparkless 
(heartless) and cared nothing for others, he lived for nothing other then 
battle. How could one with such a kind spark even think of him as a friend?
He looked down at his mech-fluid stained hand again as Tavatron walked away, 
somehow, someway,she was trying to see something else in him, something 
other then...a warrior.
Dinobot looked from his hand and watched Tavatron walk down the hall, what 
was she trying to find, what was she looking for? He looked back towards the 
doors and growled deeply, it wouldn't matter anyway...there was NOTHING 
there to find! Nothing at all...but a warrior. A warrior that had taken 
years to make, that had taken so long to become what it was today. Sparkless 
and cold!
Dinobot snarled as he thought of those two words, 'sparkless and cold.' The 
very definition of himself, nothing more...nothing less.
He glared at the doors and dug his claw into his palm again, a harsh reality 
but one none the less.
Dinobot dug his claw deeper as he continued to think, a reality that had 
come into solid form as he had lived his past life. He had had to learn how 
to become cold and emotionless in order to survive his training as a 
Predacon soldier, before he had joined Primal.
But it was Primal and his people that had tried to show him that there was 
more to life then complete discipline, there was...life itself!
Dinobot sighed and relaxed his hand, perhaps he would some day see what 
Primal saw? The secret that made a warrior much more then what he was now, 
more then he could ever dream.
Dinobot looked back in the direction that Tavatron disappeared in, did she 
know what that secret was?*
